required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NK Cells Infusion for Advanced Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Research of Natural Killer (NK) Cells Infusion for the Treatment of Advanced Malignant Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to explore the safety and efficacy of natural killer (NK) cell infusion as treatment for patients with advanced malignant tumors after multiline therapy, and to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of NK cells in patients

primary_outcome.measure: Successful expansion of NK cells in patient's circulatory system
primary_outcome.description: CD56 positive cells ≥100 cells/μL in blood is considered as successful expansion of NK cells

primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after all the treatment finished
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients who reach complete response（CR）or partial response （PR）after all treatment finished. The response is evaluated according to irRECIST.

secondary_outcome.description: The interval time from the date when patients are enrolled into study to death or the last visit
The interval time from the date when patients are enrolled into study to disease progression, death or last visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Dynamic changes of NK cells number in blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1,3,5,7,10,14,21,28 and 2, 3, 6 months after NK cells infusion finished
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers of CD56 positive cell in peripheral blood

intervention.description: Pretreatment：patients enrolled in this study will receive 20 mg/kg of cyclophosphamide for solid tumor or 20-60 mg/kg of cyclophosphamide for hematological tumor once daily for 3 times. NK cells infusion is allowed within 2-14 days after treatment. NK cells infusion：30-60 minutes before infusion，ant-allergic agents are applied (promethazine 25mg,i.m. ; Cimetidine 0.4g i.v. ; diphenhydramine 50mg po.). NK cells are intravenously infused into patients with 15-30 minutes every other day for one to three times. The number of every infused NK cells is 1-3×10^7/kg, counted as the number of CD56+ cells. Patients with severe pleural or ascites can also receive pleural or abdominal cavity perfusion simultaneously. The total number of infused NK cells is no more than 5×10^9 cells. 4 hours after NK cells infusion，IL-2 is applied every other day for six times

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Department of Medical Oncology
